DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to test the hypothesis of whether contrast enhanced Magnetic Resonance Imaging can be used to predict improvement of the wall motion in regions of the heart with abnormal movement following bypass surgery or percutaneous angioplasty in various institutions across three continents.
DOC.criteria: Age: > 21 years and < 85 years Sinus rhythm Weight < 120 kg LVEF > 30% Wall motion abnormality on Echo. or LVgram Scheduled for revascularization Angioplasty/Stent or CABG within 30 days Resting heart rate > 100 bpm Frequent atrial or ventricular ectopy Severe aortic stenosis or HOCM Unstable angina Myocardial infarction within 14 days Active congestive heart failure Pregnancy Known allergy to gadolinium Contraindication to MRI
